page.title: 08 The School Association
page.content:
The School Association started in June 1982. It was opened because Mr. Bray, the headmaster, wanted parents to get to know each other.
The School's first{fund raising}event was for money for curtains in the school hall. The second one was to convert the village hall car park to make a bigger playground. Mr. Wright was the first chairman in June 1982.
The School Association meets once a month at Corvedale. Mr. Wright, who is now Association secretary, came to talk to us about his work. He said it takes up most of his spare time.
School governors are for looking after the school and making sure the school is being run properly.
